body_html: The problem occurs only for lambdas and closures but I really think there's no way around that. Passing in dill as pickle_module arg to torch.save should help, but serializing bytecode is a very bad idea. The checkpoints will likely only load under the exact same Python version that was used to save them.
body_text: The problem occurs only for lambdas and closures but I really think there's no way around that. Passing in dill as pickle_module arg to torch.save should help, but serializing bytecode is a very bad idea. The checkpoints will likely only load under the exact same Python version that was used to save them.
body: The problem occurs only for lambdas and closures but I really think there's no way around that. Passing in `dill` as `pickle_module` arg to `torch.save` should help, but serializing bytecode is a very bad idea. The checkpoints will likely only load under the exact same Python version that was used to save them.
